page.title: 10THE WAY OF LIFE NASH AREA
page.content: Although major items must be bought outside, services to the villages are necessary to the communities. Nash Village Shop and Post Office stocks most essentials. This store has been run, since the 1890's until recently by the Harris family. Mobile services include the library van, fishmonger, greengrocer, butcher and baker. Milk is delivered daily. The local public houses are meeting places for some, The Bell in Beachampton and the Old English Gentleman in Nash offer meals and outdoor facilities where children can play. Darts matches are also arranged. Young people show an interest in pop music, fashion and hair and beauty products, but must travel to find organised events. A weekly bus service to Milton Keynes illustrates the need for independent transport.
